Description: Tondo, stem, and foot sherd of Attic black-figured pottery cup, close to type B; foot with broad stand ring; interior: in tondo black-figure decoration consisting of youth (top of rather large head and lower legs lost) with discus, to right; exterior glazed black; edge of foot reserved, narrow black band around foot; underside reserved; lowest part of inside of stem black.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For another similar type B foot, see Agora XXIII, no. 1780, which is probably by the same hand. Both lack the offset on top of the foot that distinguishes a 'true' type B cup.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0648) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
